tool.name: dada2: mergePairs
tool.description: Merge denoised forward and reverse reads

configfiles.configfile:
library(dada2, quietly=T)
dadaF <- readRDS('$dadaF') dadaR <- readRDS('$dadaR')
merged <- mergePairs(dadaF, '$derepF', dadaR, '$derepR', minOverlap = $minOverlap, maxMismatch = $maxMismatch, ## currently not accessible by the wrapper returnRejects = FALSE, propagateCol = character(0), justConcatenate = $justConcatenate, trimOverhang = $trimOverhang)
saveRDS(merged, file='$merged') ##For display in Galaxy this could be transposed (..but the user could also do it herself) ##write.table(merged, "$merged", quote=F, sep="\t", row.names = F, col.names = T)

param.label: Forward reads
param.help: despite the parameter name the sequences don't need to be dereplicated

param.label: Reverse reads
param.help: despite the parameter name the sequences don't need to be dereplicated

param.label: Concatenated rather than merge
param.help: The forward and reverse-complemented reverse read are concatenated rather than merged, with a 10 Ns spacer inserted between them

param.label: Trim overhangs
param.help: Overhangs are when the reverse read extends past the start of the forward read, and vice-versa, as can happen when reads are longer than the amplicon and read into the other-direction primer region

tool.help:
Description ...........
This function attempts to merge each denoised pair of forward and reverse reads, rejecting any pairs which do not sufficiently overlap (at least 12bp by default) or which contain too many (>0 by default) mismatches in the overlap region.
Usage .....
**Input**
- reads and learned error rates of the forward reads - reads and learned error rates of the reverse reads
**Output**
- a data set of type dada2_mergepairs (which is a RData file containing the output of dada2's mergePairs function).
Details .......
